intro: Hermannia salviifolia var. oblonga, commonly known as the broad-leaved Hermannia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its ornamental value is appreciated in gardens for its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
